Legal_Issue: Whether the Respondent met the residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Type: Days spent in Canada, employment abroad, tax implications, family ties
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet physical presence requirement for citizenship

Evidence_Ignored: Extended family ties in Canada, efforts to secure employment in Canada, tax filing behavior
Application_Factor: Physical presence (688 days), work abroad, vacations outside Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Improper application of the Koo test in assessing residency
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act, Koo test
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient demonstration of residency under statutory and jurisprudential framework

Relevant_Law: Citizenship Act, Koo v. Canada jurisprudence
Procedural_Issue: Failure to follow established analytical framework (Koo test)
